results.title: Cop land
results.creator_credit: Woods Entertainment, Miramax Films, Gary Woods, Cathy Konrad, Ezra Swerdlow and James Mangold
results.brief_description: Freddy Heflin is a simple, small-town sheriff whose life is about to change. After he uncovers evidence of murder, faked suicide and police tampering, Freddy must choose between the man he idolizes, the woman he adores and the law he’s sworn to defend. Cast includes Sylvester Stallone, Harvey Keitel, Ray Liotta, Robert de Niro.

results.title: Cool runnings
results.creator_credit: Walt Disney Pictures, Dawn Steel and Jon Turteltaub
results.brief_description: The world was shocked when Jamaica entered the Winter Olympics with a bobsled team. Although they don’t win gold, the four Jamaicans become heroes for their courage and determination to compete with the world’s best. John Candy plays the ex-Olympian, once accused of cheating, who acts as their coach. Based on a true story “Cool Runnings” repeats the ageless Disney film message about following your dreams.

results.title: Cool hand Luke
results.creator_credit: Jalem Productions, Warner Bros Pictures, Gordon Carroll and Stuart Rosenberg
results.brief_description: Paul Newman stars as “Cool Hand Luke”, the irreverent loner, sentenced to work on a chain gang for destroying parking meters. George Kennedy stars as the sadistic convict boss who tries to break Newman’s spirit by using an arsenal of punishments and torture such as ‘the box’; a windowless cubicle designed to drive an inmate insane. In one of his most memorable parts, Newman as Luke, will not allow himself to succumb to the arbitrary rules of captivity. Nevertheless, the audience is left with an impression of Luke as a victim to be pitied rather than scorned.

results.title: Continental divide
results.creator_credit: Universal Studios, Amblin Entertainment, Bob Larson and Michael Apted
results.brief_description: A romantic comedy starring John Belushi as a Chicago reporter who becomes a Mafia target following his series of articles exposing corruption. Hoping to alleviate the situation, his editor sends him on an assignment to a remote location in the Rocky Mountains to write a feature story on a reclusive researcher (Blair Brown) studying the endangered American bald eagle. Initially reluctant, she lets Belushi stay and despite radical differences their mutual attraction gradually draws them together. Cast also includes: Allen Goorwitz, Carlyn Glynn, Tony Ganios, Val Avery and Bill Henderson. Music composed and conducted by Michael Small. Editing, Dennis Virkler. Cinematography, John Bailey. Script, Lawrence Kasdan.

results.title: Contempt = Le Mepris
results.creator_credit: Rome Paris Films, Concordia, C C Champion (Rome), Georges de Beauregard, Carlo Ponti and Jean-Luc Godard
results.brief_description: When aspiring playwright Paul Javal (Michel Piccoli) is called in as script doctor on a film of The Odyssey, he is caught between a director (Fritz Lang) who wants to capture the reality of Homer’s world, and crass producer Prokosch (Jack Palance) who just wants more mermaids. As his artistic integrity gradually succumbs to the power of Prakosch’s chequebook, his wife Camille (Bardot) regards him with increasing contempt. This video includes the original cinema trailer.

results.title: Conquest of Everest
results.creator_credit: Countrymen Productions, Group 3, John Taylor, Leon Clore and Grahame Tharp
results.brief_description: A record of the successful Everest expedition in 1953. Beginning with a brief account of earlier expeditions, this film shows the months of preparation, the arrival of the expedition party in Nepal, the hiring of the sherpas in Katmandu, the progress from one camp to another and the final assault by Hillary and Tenzing. Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: Confidential Report = Mr Arkadin
results.creator_credit: Sevilla Studios, Louis Dolivet and Orson Welles
results.brief_description: Two corpses on the Naples quayside lead Guy Van Stratten into the bizarre world of Mr Arkadin, a fabulously rich tycoon with a beautiful daughter and a shady past, which he claims to have forgotten. Van Stratten is hired to investigate - with murderous results. Welles’ second European film returned to the fascination with total power which had made “Citizen Kane” his youthful masterpiece. Arkadin is closer to Harry Lime than to Kane, because he is a profiteer … who nourishes himself on the corruption of the universe. Stars Michael Redgrave, Katina Paxinou and Akim Tamiroff.

results.title: Compulsion
results.creator_credit: Darryl F. Zanuck, Cinema Scope Pictures, Richard Zanuck and Richard Fleischer
results.brief_description: Based on the true story of the Leopold-Loeb murder case, Orson Welles stars as lawyer Jonathan Wilk, whose defence against capital punishment saves the lives of two teenagers , Judd and Artie. The two homosexual teenagers were charged with murdering a young boy as an example of their intellectual superiority. Bradford Dillman and Dean Stockwell star as the two accused, one sadistic, the other submissive, in this dramatic character study based on newspaper reporter Meyer Levin’s bestseller.

results.title: Colonel Redl = Oberst Redl [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Mafilm Sudio Objectiv, Mokep, Film Und Fersehen, Zweites Deutsches Fernsehen, Osterreichischer Rundfunk-Fernsehen and Istvan Szabo
results.brief_description: Alfred Redl is one of the most infamous and ambitious figures of modern European history. The son of a poor railway worker, he “invented” the story of his life to gain acceptance to the ranks of the aristocracy and to climb to the pinnacle of the Austro-Hungarian military regime. As head of military intelligence during the last days of the corrupt Austro-Hungarian Empire, he committed suicide amid accusations of spying for the Russians, treason and homosexuality. More interested in the political and emotional texture of the story than in its historical verisimilitude, this film unmasks a strong, charismatic man made vulnerable by his hunger for success and barely masked insecurities that provides the film’s riveting subject matter. Klaus Maria Brandauer’s impersonation of Redl is chilling and disturbing. Nominated for an Oscar for best foreign film, winner of the Jury prize at the Cannes Film Festival, this film is a dazzling drama of power and intrigue.
